intro: Navarretia androsacea, commonly known as the Androsace navarretia, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Navarretia androsacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
